name: Sheraton Athlone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from three nights, great break, enjoyed every minute
reviews.title: great break, loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff, breakfast and hotel all great
reviews.title: Summer Wedding in the Sheraton Athlone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room was good, bathroom great and bed very comfortable. Made use of the pool and it was again very good.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is central to everything and has a huge shopping complex next to it. Staff very friendly and there was a good vibe In the baR. Food was just alright but not bad, that's just the bar. I didn't eat dinner in restaurant.
reviews.title: Super hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Theres also a wine and cheese demo on Monday and Wednesday which is complimentary, a nice touch.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Sheraton for a second time- had dinner fri night there which was simply divine- staff very friendly and room clean and contemporary. Lady at desk told us at check in we had been upgraded to tower suite however although nice it was no different to the last room we stayed in and access to it was soon confusing as there was several lifts to get there from the car park. Got used to it though. Love the way this hotel is joined to the shopping centre and so central. Wil most def return
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: myself and my ma and sister stayed here for 1 night for the kick back friday night special - b and b, chocolate strawberries, afternoon tea and scones and a free beauty treatment in the spa rooms. It was absolutely fabulous to all the girls out there you have to go ! :) The hotel is right above the shopping centre and you have all the big shops Next,Topshop,M & S , etc. Across the road you have another shopping centre with Dunnes, Penneys etc and not forgeting The Frock Shop 2nd hand Boutique ! The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel in Athlone !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant and the food was great quality and a great choice in the early bird menu. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was of a very high standard also. The spa was excellent! After your treatment, you are brought to a rest room where you have can relax for a little while and have your choice of magazines and fruit, strawberries, icecold water with lemon what more could a girl ask for! . Staff were brilliant in both of these areas of the hotel. Overall, an excellent stay that I would recommend to anyone and everyone. We come here a couple of times a year its our favourite girly weekend and will definately be back again soon.! Thumbs up from us! :)
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here a couple of times with family (3 kids <10 yrs). Everything is always good with great value. Pool good. No complaints. Can't beat it for value for money. Only complaint is that the kids menu is poor/limited so we had to split an adult portion for them.
reviews.title: Great room and comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: We had superb room in the tower block with great views. Really comfortable bed. Often, though, took a long time in the queue to ask questions at reception in the evening - only one person on duty. The "old thyme" restaurant nearby was great value for pre-theatre but is popular so pre-book
reviews.title: 4 star hotel, 5 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 11th wedding anniversary weekend to the Sheraton in Athlone. Couldn't fault the place. Our room was large with lovely view, very modern with massive bed and lovely bathroom in the 'tower'. The breakfast was plentiful and we were seated immediately on both mornings despite arriving around 1030am. Had a lovely 4 course evening meal too, of great quality. Live music at the bar and a great pool area made it a lovely week-end, topped when the staff brought out a piece of 'Happy Anniversary' cake after breakfast - a lovely touch. Thankyou. Only one trivial matter but the background music was awful!!!! Maybe I'm just getting old!
reviews.title: V Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped at Athlone on our way to Limerick. Very friendly receptionist on arrival and prompt check in. Secure underground car park which includes 24 security guards & CCTV, excellent for motorcycle. Large comfortable room with separate bath and shower, usual flat screen TV, iron and tea/coffee. View from room was disappointing but our stay was short. The hotel has an excellent pool, steam room etc, great to unwind after a long journey.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A shopping centre is next to the hotel and Athlone offers good bars.
reviews.title: Expected better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Special thanks to the car park attendant who looked after the motorcycle!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night. We have eaten here before and thought we would come for a stay. Check in was slow and so another girl stepped into help. She was less than friendly and seems to have lost interest as soon as she seen we had booked through lastminute.com.
reviews.title: Possibly one of the best Sheratons I've been to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are the best thing about this hotel. This property is not up to the usual Sheraton standard. We booked a suite and 2 other standard rooms as a break with family. There wasn't anything special about the suite which was way over priced. It's a glorified family room without the extra bedding as all we saw that was different was the square footage and a couch for seating. The decor of the room is nothing exceptional and the couch has a used 70's feeling about it - cheap effort at a retro I guess. The main lobby area is grotty and needs a good clean up. The seating area is not effective with couches on top of each other with coffee tables that weigh a ton which have to be shifted back and forth to access the space which doesn't provide enough leg room. The carpet throughout the hotel needs to be replaced.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personal GPS is a requirement as the hotel has a convoluted room numbering system which would be a nightmare in an emergency. The tower has a block of 400 numbers regardless of which floor level you are staying on and you need to switch elevators to access the main level.
reviews.title: Great location in centre of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: The highlight of the trip was the staff - they are very friendly and efficient. Dean was very helpful to us, personable and a true asset to this hotel as well as Mark and Olivia who assisted us at reception. Unfortunately with all the hotels to chose from in Ireland I wouldn't recommend this for a mini break.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights, overall very impressed. Nice clean, modern hotel.
reviews.title: Let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms were spacious, great air-con. Bathrooms were a bit small and dark but ok.
reviews.title: Great time with family

description: A local landmark in Athlone thanks to its 12 story glazed tower, Sheraton Athlone Hotel is a unique hotel in Ireland. Offering all of the comfort you can expect from a four star hotel, including 167 luxurious bedrooms and suites, with many affording spectacular views over the River Shannon and Ireland's lakelands, as well as outstanding spa facilities. Health & Leisure facilities include a remarkable aquatics area with 18m pool, 3 feature pools and state of the art fitness equipment. Sheraton Athlone Hotel is located beside the Athlone Town Centre shopping centre giving it prime location, and only 70 minutes from Dublin, which makes it perfect for business or leisure.
